dt: {bc}the rear end or a process or prolongation of the rear end of the body of an animal
{bc}something resembling an animal's tail in shape or position: such as
{bc}a luminous stream of particles, gases, or ions extending from a comet especially in the antisolar direction
{bc}the rear part of an airplane consisting usually of horizontal and vertical stabilizing surfaces with attached control surfaces
{bc}a location immediately or not far behind
{bc}one (such as a detective) who follows or keeps watch on someone
{bc}the back, last, lower, or inferior part of something
{bc}the blank space at the bottom of a page

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}tægel{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}zagal{/it} tail, Middle Irish {it}dúal{/it} lock of hair
shortdef: the rear end or a process or prolongation of the rear end of the body of an animal
something resembling an animal's tail in shape or position: such as
a luminous stream of particles, gases, or ions extending from a comet especially in the antisolar direction

dt: {bc}to remove the stem or bottom part of
{bc}to make or furnish with a tail
{bc}to follow or be drawn behind like a tail
{bc}to form or move in a straggling line
{bc}to grow progressively smaller, fainter, or more scattered {bc}{sx|abate||}
{bc}to swing or lie with the stern in a named direction
used of a ship at anchor

shortdef: to follow for purposes of surveillance
to remove the tail of (an animal) : dock

dt: {bc}one of a subspecies ({it}Odocoileus hemionus columbianus{/it}) especially of British Columbia, Oregon, and Washington

shortdef: mule deer; especially : one of a subspecies (Odocoileus hemionus columbianus) especially of British Columbia, Oregon, and Washington

dt: {bc}a coarse-wooled mutton sheep that has great quantities of fat on each side of the tail bones

shortdef: a coarse-wooled mutton sheep that has great quantities of fat on each side of the tail bones

dt: {bc}any of a family (Molossidae) of bats characterized by a tail that projects beyond the posterior part of the flight membrane and found in warm regions of the world

shortdef: any of a family (Molossidae) of bats characterized by a tail that projects beyond the posterior part of the flight membrane and found in warm regions of the world

dt: {bc}a common sea duck ({it}Clangula hyemalis{/it}) of the more northern parts of the northern hemisphere of which the adult male is marked with sharply contrasted black and white and has the middle tail feathers very long and slender and the female is plainer and lacks the long tail feathers

shortdef: a common sea duck (Clangula hyemalis) of the more northern parts of the northern hemisphere of which the adult male is marked with sharply contrasted black and white and has the middle tail feathers very long and slender and the female is plainer and lacks the long tail feathers

dt: {bc}a common {d_link|weasel|weasel:1} ({it}Mustela frenata{/it}) found from southern Canada to northern South America often near water that is an aggressive carnivore feeding chiefly on rodents and other small mammals, is brown above and white to yellowish below in summer and in its northern range usually white in winter, and ranges in length from 15 to 23 inches (38 to 58.4 centimeters) long including a black-tipped tail that is usually 3 ½ to 6 ½ (9 to 16.5 centimeters) inches long
The long-tailed weasel is also known as the {it}bridled weasel{/it} due to white and yellowish facial markings often present chiefly in southern populations.

shortdef: a common weasel (Mustela frenata) found from southern Canada to northern South America often near water that is an aggressive carnivore feeding chiefly on rodents and other small mammals, is brown above and white to yellowish below in summer and in its northern range usually white in winter, and ranges in length from 15 to 23 inches (38 to 58.4 centimeters) long including a black-tipped tail that is usually 3 ½ to 6 ½ (9 to 16.5 centimeters) inches long

dt: {bc}being a statistical test for which the critical region consists of all values of the test statistic greater than a given value or less than a given value but not both {dx}compare {dxt|two-tailed||}{/dx}

shortdef: being a statistical test for which the critical region consists of all values of the test statistic greater than a given value or less than a given value but not both
